channel.title: PopSci
channel.description:
Anyone else read. Really cool magazine. If your a noob...It's called [b][i]Popular Science.[/i][/b]
Yea, maybe nerdy but you know what...Who the hell cares? It's cool :cool:

item.title: PopSci
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I enjoy Popular Science, although I have just gotten my subscription renewed. It is sometimes funny to check on their gadgets later, as in one magazine they had a $1000 box that supposedly turned your gas car into a hydrogen car [was in PopSci in late 2006, gadget was supposed to come out January 2007].

Read full topic

item.title: PopSci
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

i read pop sci, pop mech, discover, pc world, maximum pc, and books. thats about it. i like discover the best when it come to science, but i like the how 2.0 in pop sci. and i like pc world a lot because it has good info on pcs, i wanna get mac world (or w/e its called) but my pops wont let me. maximum pc is good for reviews, and thats about it. and book are good when im bored.

Read full topic

item.title: PopSci
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:8, topic:140940”][quote author=Exception link=topic=193159.msg1738714#msg1738714 date=1189231061]
I used to read it, but my mom stopped subscribing for me after she saw all the cheap Viagra ads in the back -.- Now I subscribe to Linux Journal.
[/quote]Stuff like that irritates me so bad…like as if a great game (GTA) has reference to…stuff…that she doesn’t like Or if I’m reading a mag and the article has a viagra ad right next to it and my Dad’s watching behind my back :([/quote]

It was pretty funny when she saw them. She was like “Oh, about that magazine, if you ever have any questions…Be sure to ask” Then the next month I never got the magazine, apparently the ‘subscription expired’.

Read full topic

item.title: PopSci
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I prefer Discover. Popular Science is just that. Popular. It’s for the general public. The uninitiated. I see stuff on the web weeks before it hits PopSci.

Read full topic
